qas.question: The loss of Edinburgh Pentlands really disappointed whom the most?
What was the seat of former party leader David McLetchie?
What net loss did the Conservatives suffer?
Who announced she would step down as leader of the Conservatives?
Who congratulated the SNP while vowing to campaign against their referendum?
For the Liberals, the main disappointment was what?
Current party leader, David McLetchie lost what seat?
Who was elected on the Lothian global list?
Who announced that she would not step down as party leader?
Who congratulated the SNP on their loss?

context: For <a0_0>the <a0_1><a0_2>Conservatives<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, the main disappointment was <b5_0>the loss of <a1_0><a1_1><b6_0>Edinburgh Pentlands<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, the seat of <a1_2>former party leader<a1_2/> <b7_0>David McLetchie<b7_0/>, to the SNP. McLetchie was elected on the Lothian regional list and the Conservatives suffered a net loss of <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>five seats<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, with leader <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>Annabel Goldie<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> claiming that their support had held firm. Nevertheless, she too announced she would step down as leader of the party. <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>Cameron<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> congratulated the SNP on their victory but vowed to campaign for the Union in the independence referendum.
